hero.subtitle: A warm, authentic Berber guesthouse in Marrakech’s Medina

about.title: Ambience & History
about.lead: Dar Tiflet is a true traditional Berber home, a century-old riad that has preserved the authenticity of its architecture and the soul of its past. Handmade zelliges, carved plaster, painted floors and walls—every detail reflects ancestral craftsmanship.
about.body: Locally crafted furniture and rugs continue this living heritage. “Dar” means house in Arabic; “Tiflet” means door in Tamazight (Berber). Today the riad’s atmosphere is intimate and convivial: the patio invites rest, the Berber salon fosters exchange, and the sunny terrace overlooks the rooftops of the medina.
about.hospitality: At Dar Tiflet, you are welcomed like friends.

rooms.title: Rooms
rooms.legend: Thick adobe walls ensure natural coolness.

items.name: Green Room
items.description: A quiet ground-floor room, ideal for couples, with adobe walls that keep a naturally cool temperature.

items.name: Bigarrée Room
items.description: Spacious and colorful, perfect for 2–3 guests, on the ground floor with a private bathroom.
items.beds: Double bed + single bed or sofa bed

items.name: Yellow Room
items.description: Upstairs and bright, with two windows overlooking the courtyard. Can be set up as twin or as a double.

items.name: Red Room
items.description: Large upstairs room with warm tones, comfortably sleeping up to three guests.
items.beds: Double bed + single bed or sofa bed

items.name: Blue Room
items.description: Upstairs, peaceful atmosphere — perfect for a stay for two.

items.name: Safi Suite
items.description: Two adjoining rooms on the ground floor — ideal for families or friends, up to 4 guests.
items.beds: Double bed + single beds/sofas across two rooms

items.name: Zina Room
items.description: Charming upstairs room overlooking the inner garden — intimate and comfortable.

items.name: Baraka Room
items.description: Upstairs with two twin beds — simple and practical for friends or siblings.

items.title: Marrakech City Tour
items.desc: Our most complete tour of Marrakech for travelers who want to make the most of the Red City. Immerse yourself in the rich history and vibrant souks of Morocco’s most exciting imperial city.

items.title: Ourika Valley Day Trip
items.desc: Among the most beautiful natural regions near Marrakech. Discover the Ourika valley in the High Atlas foothills—fresh rivers, greenery and Berber villages. A peaceful escape into nature.

policies.title: Policies
policies.min_stay_direct: Direct bookings & partner agencies: 1 night minimum.
policies.payments: Secure online payment via Payzone (coming soon).

footer.tagline: A traditional Berber house in the heart of the medina.

location.title: Location
location.desc: In the heart of Marrakech’s medina, in the Ben Salah area — a quiet lane with authentic neighborhood life.
tips: 50 m from Ben Salah street & square
Car access not possible to the door (pedestrian zone)
We can arrange airport/train shuttle on request

items.name: Alice M.
items.text: Warm welcome and a genuine riad experience. Quiet at night, great breakfast, and lovely rooftop views of the Koutoubia.

items.name: Youssef B.
items.text: Perfect location in the medina. The team helped with tips and transfers. Rooms keep naturally cool, which was a big plus.

items.name: Sofia R.
items.text: Authentic style with modern comfort. We loved the patio and the Berber salon. Felt like staying at a friend’s home.

items.name: Daniel P.
items.text: Clean, charming, and very friendly hosts. Breakfast on the terrace was a highlight.

items.name: Maya K.
items.text: Great value in the heart of the medina. Easy walk to Ben Salah and the souks.

items.name: Lena S.
items.text: Peaceful, tasteful, and comfortable. We’ll be back!

services_page.title: Services & Experiences
services_page.subtitle: Comfort, guidance and local know-how — so you can enjoy Marrakech like a friend of the house.
services_page.intro: We can arrange your arrival, breakfasts, tips and excursions, luggage storage and more. Ask us anything — we’re here to help.

items.name: Airport / Train Station Shuttle
items.body: We meet you at the exit with a sign, follow the taxi together to the riad and handle the last meters. No stress on arrival.
items.note: Please share flight number and arrival time.

items.name: Breakfast
items.body: Mixed European and Moroccan breakfast with pastries, pancakes and fruit. Allergies or vegetarian? Tell us and we’ll adapt.

items.name: City Tips & Excursion Info
items.body: Personalized map, best times to visit, new restaurant ideas, gift shopping, trusted partners for day trips or desert treks.

items.name: Luggage Storage
items.body: Between two stays or while you explore, we can keep your bulky luggage safe. We can also accommodate 1–2 bicycles.

dining.title: La Table de Dar Tiflet
dining.subtitle: Homemade Berber & Moroccan cuisine served on the rooftop — with a direct view of the Koutoubia at sunset.
bullets: Daily set menu, homemade: tajines, couscous, pastilla, zaalouk, harira…
Fresh bread baked on site, fruits and Moroccan desserts
Vegetarian and allergy-friendly options on request
dining.reserve_note: Meals are served by reservation only (minimum 6 hours in advance).
dining.bar_body: Mint tea and traditional infusions, fresh orange juice, lemonade, smoothies, mineral water, sodas and coffee. A quiet moment above the medina.

dining_page.title: Dining
dining_page.subtitle: Home-cooked Berber & Moroccan cuisine on the rooftop.
dining_page.intro: On our panoramic terrace, we serve a simple, generous table in the spirit of the house. Expect seasonal tajines, couscous and salads — all homemade and served with care.

menu.title: La Table de Dar Tiflet
highlights: Homemade, daily menu inspired by Berber & Moroccan recipes
Rooftop view toward the Koutoubia, magical at sunset
Vegetarian and allergy-friendly options on request

bar.title: Tiflet Counter — Non-alcoholic Bar
bar.body: Enjoy mint tea and traditional infusions, fresh juices and homemade lemonades, smoothies, mineral water, sodas and coffee — a quiet moment above the medina.
bar.note: No alcohol is served, in respect of the house and the medina.

gallery_page.title: Gallery
gallery_page.subtitle: A glimpse of the house, the rooftop and Marrakech life.

about_page.title: About
about_page.subtitle: A traditional Berber house with a living soul.
about_page.intro: Dar Tiflet is a century-old riad rooted in the medina. We preserve its authentic architecture and a warm, simple way of hosting.

story.title: Ambience & History
paragraphs: Dar Tiflet is a true traditional Berber house, nestled in the vibrant heart of Marrakech’s medina. Once the family home of a Berber grocer, the riad has kept the spirit of its past alive.

Handmade zelliges, carved plaster, and walls built in pisé all tell the story of local craft and time-honored technique. Furnishings and rugs are sourced from artisans close by, continuing this living heritage.
“Dar” means house in Arabic; “Tiflet” means door in Tamazight — a nod to the house’s double identity: a place that is both open and intimate.
Today the atmosphere is intimate and friendly: the central patio invites rest, the Berber salon is for conversation, and the rooftop opens over the medina. Here, guests are welcomed like friends.

highlights.title: Central patio
highlights.body: A quiet heart of the house for tea and rest.

highlights.title: Rooftop views
highlights.body: Wide open sky and a line to the Koutoubia at sunset.

highlights.title: Berber salon
highlights.body: A living room for stories and exchange.

highlights.title: Berber hospitality
highlights.body: Sincere, simple, attentive — like welcoming friends.

members.name: Yassine
members.bio: Resident host and heart of Dar Tiflet. A guardian of Berber tradition who goes the extra mile for guests. Loves countryside souks — and reading your reviews.

members.name: Mohamed
members.bio: Discreet and attentive, with a special care for families. Always welcoming with a genuine, broad smile.

members.name: Ibrahim
members.bio: From the Southern Atlas beyond the Dadès Valley. Loves sharing Tamazight culture and can write your name in Arabic and in Tifinagh — always with a huge smile.

map.title: Where we are
map.body: Ben Saleh quarter, a few minutes from the souks and the main sights. We’re happy to guide your arrival.

contact_page.title: Contact
contact_page.subtitle: We’re happy to help — send a message and we’ll reply shortly.
contact_page.intro: Questions about arrival, rooms or the neighborhood? Write to us here or use WhatsApp for a quick reply.
